review: This is a great no frills habit tracker app without any pesky ads. Does exactly what it's supposed to do with a clean and minimalistic UI. A couple of suggestions to the Dev would be to add a threshold option while setting up a habit(like no more than x); if it's crossed then the streak would be broken. Also to add time as a unit, if my wake up time is 7am and I wake up at 7.30, it should show as failed and not aggregate the daily time in the stats. Thanks a lot for creating such an amazing app

First of all I would like to say that this is a great app with a very clean look which shows the progress which you want to see. Only, one feature that I like you to add would be for the Habits where we need to put values, if it can show a threshold line for the minimum requirement, or if the bar colour changes for the days you were not able to achieve tour goal that would be great. I hope it gets added in a future update

You are an absolute Chad for making such an App Free and Open Source. Its Clean, Simple and Intuitive. I have a few feature suggestion. A target that increases by a set amount after a set amount of time could be helpful. Say you want to improve a habit by 1% everyday. Then the target amount should also increase by 1 percent everyday for that task. This would allow for gradual improvement over an extended time frame, which in my opinion is better than completing a static target amount.

Dear Alinson, The app is phenomenal, simple and great one. It has been a great value ad. Please can you help by adding "Search Field to Find a habit" on the menu. Please help with provision of updating time schedule across each habit, it would add more to the benefit because habits when developed consistently across the same time, builds a human being's character. And lastly a provision for compartmentalising set of habits. Thank you so much for this lovely gift. Take care.

The app is all great!! Using it since a long time. While using i always feel that there is one thing missing. Because of that one thing i have to look for other apps. I like all the features of the app but also i don't like the calender layout. Can u pleaseee make changes in it and give it a traditional calendar look. Or at least give the option to choose among the 2 layouts.

This has been my favourite app to track and develop habits. It also seems to incorporate the idea of habit inertia where you're allowed to miss a day or two if your overall commitment is strong. The ux is simple and intuitive and dark mode looks great. Unlike other so-called premium apps, there are no distracting bells and whistles (or ads). Overall, a simple and effective way to build your habits. Is there a way to support via donations?

This is exactly the app I was looking for!! Simple interface, minimalistic design, no-nonsense app. On top of that: no adds or in app purchases. And a powerful analysis tool. What else could one ask for? Brilliant work I must sayüëèüëè Has made my dayüòä. The only issue is that sometimes, the notifications fail to pop up. Then it gets a little annoying. So, if you can bear up with that then this is the perfect app for you. I hope this bug gets removed soon

Excellent app. An app which has a holistic and simple interface for activity scheduling. Its very easy to understand and use. Its a checklist cum schedule. It gives you a live report card which is the most important aspect. If you are addicted to the screen, avoid ticking the list after every session to reduce screen time. Just mark it on a paper and tick off at the end of the day. You can set reminders to check mails and messages. No adds or any unwanted suggestions.

It was a great experience using the app. It does help us to stick to our goals.The graph and statistics part provides an insight into our performance so far. The sticky notifications is the best part , because we feel so irritated with the notification that we end up doing the task just to avoid this notification pestering us! So it might be a great choice for people who procrastinate a lot but would love to get their tasks completed on time . Also , this would be a good Digital Habit tracker !

Absolutely love this app and the service it provides. Really clean interface and helps that it has these widgets that make updating information a breeze. Would be great if you could add some more colour options for the highlight colours, within the app as well as the widgets. No big deal. The app is near perfect for all my needs. Have recommended to a bunch of friends and clients as well.

I have used the app for only a couple of months now. Love the scoring system and the related graph the most, which makes it really easy to see how well I'm doing over a period, rather than just the streaks. Multiple streaks display, with all of them in one place. Very easy and simple interface -the best proof for simplicity rules. Recommend to anyone trying to build it maintain a habit!

I have been using this app since few years. It's very minimal and absolutely great. Thank you. :) Can you add an option where we can mark as "X" if we didn't do it.. "Tick" "Cross" and "Blank" ?? Coz sometimes I don't realise if I didn't do the task that day or I forgot to open the app.. If there is an option to "cross".. it would be clear that I haven't finished the task that day.. and if it is empty.. it just means I forgot to update the status.

The simplicity and ease of use is the best thing. I've tried using numerous apps which have a lotof features I wanted but eventually they became too tedious to do everyday. I think if keeping track of our habits itself becomes a difficult habit to maintain, then it's doomed to fail. This app lets me not only mark habits as done/not done, but also makes the distinction between a lapse (failure) and a skip (not a failure). And it still remains easy to use!

Would just like to have a small feature changed, where the top scroll only shows the date and day. It sadly does not mention the month and year. So basically something like a week/month view like most calendar app, but even in a simple view. Also, have you considered allowing 0 of 7 days as a valid tracking option. It'll help to track habits you're trying to break. Love the app btw, really cool

I love it. I absolutely love it. Suggestion: Could you please make it look aesthetically better? I mean, I like this look, but it's really compact and dense and the crosses that you hold to transform them into ticks don't feel very satisfying due to their small size. You know, that little "satisfaction of the click" makes all the difference in the world. It's a mental trigger to make you want more of that feeling. Also, please introduce more colours. All that for aesthetics.

This app is so good. Have been searching for an app like this. There are other good apps but they don't let you create your own habits. And they most of the times show your progress in the form of a graph or something. This app shows me my monthly achievements throughout the month in a glance. I wanted something that could show me how often I have followed a habit in the whole month. I love it..

I haven't used it for long but already have found it useful, the UI is clean, minimal and aesthetic it is very pleasing to get some data in and see all those stats and the app also has widgets that is a good way to remind myself to do something everytime I use my phone , very helpful app! Update: been using it for 9 months now and got to say it's one of the best productivity apps I've ever installed. I still stand by my first impressions.

It's been of great use! I use the app to track my workout plan. It has been doing just that smoothly. Lately, the app has developed a glitch. It automatically highlights days that I did not tap. I cannot even undo them. It forcibly counts them as days I have worked out. Please fix this issue soon. Its defeating the purpose of the app.

I've been using this app for over a year now and there are a few things that I feel is missing from the app: 1. Data synchronisation: Add a feature where we can save our data online automatically after each entry. 2. iOS app: I'm thinking of switching over to iPhone but the sad part is that your app is not available on App Store. This leads me to move over an alternative app which will be compatible on both platforms. 3. Add more vibrant colours to Habit Names. Thanks for this beautiful app!

This app is very good, easy, helpful with good design. The features it includes are the exact ones I was looking for. I am grateful for the app. It increased my performance, skill set and helped me to keep up the pace. BUT I have one suggestion. I need multiple windows. For example one for tracking general habbits, one for tasks related to the professional life, one for tracking learning sets etc. I guess, if this is implemented, this app goes next level. And I also rate five starts. Thanks.

It's an incredible app, maybe the first app which truly has me sticking to my habits, hats off to the sticky notification config. I have one minor backend feature request though - the notifications/reminders only pop up when the app is opened. This somewhat defeats the point of reminders, as I have to open the app to be reminded of all habits i missed so far. Can this be configurable so that it integrates natively as push notifications? Only reason for one less star, all else perfect.

This is a complete habit tracking app. I've tried many apps which had many over the top things like goals, dreams, etc. but failed to manage having a proper notification with a Yes or No button. This is, by far, the best habit tracking app I've used. The good; ‚Ä¢ It's simplicity. ‚Ä¢ It's free and has no ads. Wow! ‚Ä¢ It manages data well and can I can back it up. ‚Ä¢ Has customisation options. Thanks developers! You are awesome!

Absolutely fantastic, useful, and visually stunning. The app is visually stunning with the dark mode. I am grateful for the fact that they developer didn't put in ads or limit functionality before a paywall. Great visualizations, graphs, and analysis are available. Highly recommend that you use it. No need to pay for apps that offer a lot less functionality and charge highly.

Review after using the app for over a month. This app needs a little sophistication. There are times when out of compulsions we are not able to stick to our goal of performing something daily. It is unhappy to see streak being lost without our mistake. There can be an option for including on a certain day a box wherein we could write why we couldnt do something that day. That can also help in future to go back and see what happened that led to non performance. That way 1 can avoid same mistake.

It satisfies all the habit tracker facilities. Tracking all habits everyday with just a simple tick, giving statistics of them and sending reminders on the set time. I really wish to have a single widget to track all the habits, where all habits can be checked with a single click in the widget. Current widgets need to be placed 1 by 1 on the home screen, an entire list of all the habits as a widget would be great and helful for a procastinator like me üôÉ

I have been using it for more than 2 months and this app definitely helped to keep me on track. I feel proud on myself each time I put a tick. It also shows a graph which goes up or down according to my habit. I feel really good when that graph goes up and up. It boosts my confidence and makes me want it to keep it like that, not to skip a day. Thankyou Loop.

It has to be the best app for tracking habits, the user interface is simple and there is a ton of statistics for each habits available. The best part is it has widgets as well that shows you the best streaks and the calendar for every habit you have. The best app, thanks to this app I am able achieve my goals everyday. And able to track them.

A simple exponential moving average way of tracking your habits is surprisingly the best I've seen till date. I used to keep track of my habit streaks and that didn't last long since you had to start again from 0, if you missed your habit for a single day. This app is a more realistic way of tracking your habits. Kudos to the developers for implementing this idea!

Best best best app in the world if you want to get in a particular schedule I would really like to thank the developer, only because of you I am not lazy anymore I am following a productive schedule. The interface is so simple and easy to understand. Prefect app for the guys who really are motivated and want to change their life. As this app is perfect and dosen't need and modifications but the least thing you can add is a bunch of motivational quote in notification about habits. Thank you.

the app is awesome. I've been using this for a long time to track my habits. the smooth and minimalist ui attracted me.but there is one thing that i require. i need cloud sync ability. why? because i have been using this app for tracking my 3-4 month old habit. unexpectedly my phone got format and i did not have the backup data for it. i had to start again. i had never expected anything like this. such a thing can discourage a dedicated person who's trying to make a change in his life. thanks!

This is one of the best Habit builder app, no app can compete with UI of this. But there are some disadvantages. 1) I want to set counter/day for a habit, once reached can only consider the task/habit as complete. Like drinking water can only be consider as complete if it is done 8 times in a day. 2) based on 1st point, I want to set multiple reminders in a day to complete the task. 3)set strike target like if user want to set number of days by which he/she can consider goal acomplished.

the app is awesome. I've been using this for a long time to track my habits. the smooth and minimalist ui attracted me.but there is one thing that i require. i need cloud sync ability. why? because i have been using this app for tracking my 3-4 month old habit. unexpectedly my phone got format and i had to start again. i had never expected anything like this. such a thing can discourage a dedicated person who's trying to make a change in his life. anyway thanks for making a +ve change in my life!

App is very useful. Features are upto the mark. Widgets are very good. However, avenue to put two or three reminders at different times of the day per habit would have been more useful for me. Conversely thinking, being minimalistic is good sometime, habit building is serious life changing task, too much features may not be a good idea always. So decision is upto the developer. Anyway, excellent.

Been using the app for well over a year now, maybe even 2 years. Love it. I do have a suggestion, not sure if it aligns with the vision you guys have for the app, but what do you think of a feature where you can track a habit for a day, multiple times. Rn, you can hold down on a day to check a habit for that day, but it would be nice to have a feature where you can track something you do multiple times throughout the day and it logs the time as well, AND it counts towards the total count.

Amazing application for being productive and keeping track! I would like to make a suggestion, if it reaches to you. On creating a checkmark widget on screen, is it possible that if I checkmark a habit, it asks me the question I have specified and I get two options, Yes or No for marking the completion. It will be a good reminder to check if I completed the task as per question! Hope it reaches you..

Eady to use, No fuss.. Works perfectly! I just wish I could make MULTIPLE accounts sort of thing in the app. For example, habits in Summer & winter differ for me. Habits that need to be followed when back to school. I would happily run paralle instance, but thats not in-built either. If the developer manages something like that, this app will be GOLD!

This app has a minimalistic design yet offers all the necessary features. Mostly habit trackers on play store offer many unnecessary features for customization which end up causing a lot of distractions. On top of that, this app is free. It's the best in class, 10/10.

I downloaded this app only last night and so far I love it. I tried a few other habit apps, most of them either charge for more than 5 habits or the interface is a bit rubbish. This app is cool and is fully editable. One thing that I've noticed (unless I've missed it), is that there's no option to set multiple alarms for each day (for example to remind me to drink water throughout the day), so I've just set multiple alarms on my phone instead. Apart from that it has everything you need imo.

I really love the simplicity of this app. It's perfect for what I need. Not too many distractions or bells and whistles, just simple tracking of what I need to do and have accomplished daily, weekly, or monthly. Helps me to remember to do recurring tasks and also take credit for the things I got done. I like that you can choose either a yes/no option or a quantity and can set goals and it shows your progress and whether they've been met, but all in a very simple, clean interface.

Very nice. Easy to update your progress and plenty of ways to view progress to keep your interest peaked at what it is you are trying to accomplish. I haven't had great success with apps in general for visual effects, but I like this one for it's charting and table views. What will they think of next? There are other features and settings. Exporting looks cool, haven't tried that yet. Might be interesting to see if the data loads into Excel for more fun.
